message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.CL 

This paper deals with the task of organizing and exploring significant abnormalities or lesions in radiology images. It involves learning a deep feature representation for each lesion and modeling their similarity relationship. This task falls under computer vision (cs.CV) as it deals with image analysis and retrieval. It also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) as it aims to organize and retrieve relevant information from a large-scale dataset. The use of deep learning techniques for feature representation and similarity modeling suggests a focus on machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the proposed algorithms for intra-patient lesion matching and missing annotation mining suggest a potential application in medical imaging (cs.MM) and natural language processing (cs.CL) for text-based annotation mining.
